text:
Thanks!
Message 1213 of 4024
The update with ICS included now is in your inbox. Please let me know if you I can help carry the load in any other way... I am assuming we can do
the meeting from the same cam together (it looks lame if the parents can't make that effort. We would have for the in-person meeting we wanted).
Since the RO says Kirland is a No No, we can do it here. I'll have things tested ahead of time and ask her for the link today. I'll dress casually but nice.
Sent:02/08/2024 at 12:35 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/08/2024 at 01:04 PM)
Subject:Re: Saas meeting
Message 1214 of 4024
Just some feedback, but some of this whole move thing is just mean. We don't have any idea who will end up where. Based on the last agreement we
had, I was going to be in the house- after I even offered to try and keep you there, but you refused.
And so much of this is junk. Stuff we should have done together when we both left the house. Now it fills three rooms, including the bedroom I had
hoped to make special for Max. That was super important to me. And now I can't even do that.
And then, some of the special things. Things that mean a lot to me are broken or f'd
- The "Microsoft" clay sculpture Elsa gave me 20 years ago
- The Allen field house floor I laid Adrian on when he was born
- Poppa's bible is all taken apart so I'll never know how he had it
- I can go on but won't
And then there are things I *thought* were us. Special things that I hoped we would wait to divvy up. It's all just thrown like trash in a bag.
We are trying to be kinder and accepting, and that's the most important thing now. But I needed to say something because this feels so rude.
- robert
Sent:02/08/2024 at 12:55 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 02/08/2024 at 01:04 PM)
Subject:My Stuff
Message 1215 of 4024
